intro: Notopleura nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered notopleura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly rough texture. Notopleura nivea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
